section.title: Vehicle features and options
section.paragraph: This chapter describes model-specific equipment, systems and functions that are available now and will be available in the future, even if they are not available in the owned vehicle.
Additional information:
Vehicle equipment.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Depending on the situation, the vehicle is in one of the three states:

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: When the vehicle is in idle state, it is switched off.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle is in idle state prior to opening from the outside and after exiting and locking.

warning.paragraph: Warning
An unsecured vehicle can begin to move and possibly roll away. There is a risk of accident. Before leaving the vehicle, secure the vehicle against rolling away.
In order to ensure that the vehicle is secured against rolling away, follow the following:

item.paragraph: On uphill grades or on downhill slopes, turn the front wheels in the direction of the curb.
On uphill grades or on downhill slopes, also secure the vehicle, for instance with a wheel chock.

overview.overview-text: Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle

warning.paragraph: Warning
Unattended children or animals in the vehicle can cause the vehicle to move and endanger themselves and traffic, for instance due to the following actions:

item.paragraph: Opening and closing the doors or windows.

warning.paragraph: There is a risk of accidents or injuries. Do not leave children or animals unattended in the vehicle. Take the vehicle key with you when exiting and lock the vehicle.

section.title: Establishing the sleep mode automatically
section.paragraph: The sleep mode is established automatically, such as in the following situations:

item.paragraph: After several minutes, if no operation takes place on the vehicle.
If the charge state of the vehicle battery is low.
Depending on the configuration via iDrive: one or both front doors will be opened after driving when exiting the vehicle.

section.paragraph: In some situations, the idle state is not set automatically, for instance during a phone call or when the low beams are switched on.

section.title: Establishing idle state when opening the front doors
section.paragraph: After a trip, the sleep mode can be established by opening the front doors. For this purpose, all passengers must exit the vehicle.

section.title: Establishing the sleep mode manually
section.paragraph: To establish idle state in the vehicle after completion of trip:

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press and hold the thumbwheel in the center console until the OFF indicator in the instrument cluster goes out.
Press and hold the button on the radio until the OFF indicator on the instrument cluster goes out.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: When standby state is switched on, most functions can be used while the vehicle is stationary. Desired settings can be adjusted.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle is in the standby state after the front doors are opened from the outside.
To preserve the vehicle battery, use standby and the activated power consumers only as long as absolutely necessary.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: Standby can be switched back on after the vehicle is automatically set to idle state.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Press thumbwheel in the center console. The control display and the instrument cluster illuminate.
Press the button on the radio. The control display and the instrument cluster illuminate.
Press the Start/Stop button. The control display and the instrument cluster illuminate.
OFF is displayed in the instrument cluster. The drivetrain is switched off and standby state switched on.

section.title: General information

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Drive-ready state is turned on or off with the Start/Stop button.

section.paragraph: Activated drive-ready state is the equivalent of a running engine in conventional vehicles.
Deactivated drive-ready state is equivalent to switching the engine off.
If the drive-ready state is turned on, the vehicle ready to drive and READY is displayed in the instrument cluster.
All vehicle systems are ready for operation.
To preserve the vehicle battery, switch off drive readiness and any unnecessary power consumers when parked.

overview.overview-text: Do not switch off standby state in the car wash

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Selector lever position P is automatically engaged when standby state is switched off. The wheels are blocked. There is a risk of damage to property. Do not switch off standby if the vehicle is meant to coast, e.g., in a car wash.

section.title: Turning off drive-ready state

action-step.paragraph: While the vehicle is stationary, depress the brake and apply the parking brake.
The READY indicator goes out and a signal tone sounds.
While the vehicle is stationary, depress the brake and engage selector lever position P.
The READY indicator goes out and a signal tone sounds.

section.paragraph: The drive-ready state is switched off automatically if the driver's seat belt is not buckled when the driver's door is opened.

section.title: Principle
section.paragraph: Turning on drive-ready state corresponds to starting the engine.

section.title: General information

overview.overview-text: Avoid repeated starting in quick succession

warning.paragraph: NOTICE

Repeated attempts to start the vehicle or repeated starting of the vehicle in rapid succession can cause the starter to overheat. This also results in unburned or inadequately burned fuel, and can cause the catalytic converter to overheat. There is a risk of damage to property, among other potential damage. Avoid repeated starting of the vehicle, particularly repeated starting in rapid succession.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: Drive-ready state is switched on via the Start/Stop button.

section.title: Turning on the drive-ready state
section.paragraph: The ignition is activated automatically for a brief time and is stopped as soon as the engine starts.
Most of the indicator/warning lights in the instrument cluster light up for a varied length of time.

section.title: Gasoline engine
section.paragraph: Depending on the motorization, the full drive power may not be available for approximately 30 seconds after starting the engine. In this case, the vehicle will not accelerate as usual.
Additional information:
Power gauge.

section.title: Diesel engine
section.paragraph: If the engine is cold and temperatures are below approx. 0 ℃0 ℃, approx. 32 ℉32 ℉/0 ℃, the starting procedure may be delayed somewhat due to automatic preheating.
A Check Control message is displayed.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: A Check Control message with yellow indicator light is displayed.

section.paragraph: After starting the engine, the full drive power may not be available until the engine is at operating temperature. Pay attention to the engine temperature display and the power gauge, if applicable. In this case, the vehicle will not accelerate as usual.

section.title: Turning on the drive-ready state

action-step.paragraph: Most of the indicator/warning lights in the instrument cluster illuminate for a varied length of time depending on the duration of the system check.

section.paragraph: Depending on the prerequisite, the electric drive-ready state or a combustion engine start is possible.

section.title: General information
section.paragraph: The vehicle is ready for driving without starting the combustion engine.

section.title: Functional requirements
section.paragraph: Electric drive-ready state is possible, if the prerequisites for electric driving are fulfilled.
Additional information:
BMW eDRIVE.

graphic-with-description.paragraph: When the drive-ready state is switched on, READY is displayed in the instrument cluster.

section.title: Combustion engine start
section.paragraph: The combustion engine is started under the following conditions when the drive-ready state is switched on:

item.paragraph: The temperature of the hybrid system is too high or too low.
The charge state of the high-voltage battery is insufficient.
The vehicle was parked in SPORT driving mode shortly beforehand.
"SPORT": The vehicle was parked in My Modes driving mode shortly beforehand.

section.title: Turning off drive-ready state

action-step.paragraph: While the vehicle is stationary, engage selector lever position P and apply the parking brake.

section.paragraph: After parking the vehicle, you may hear noises due to operation of the hybrid system, such as for cooling of the high-voltage battery.
